health.description: The relative risk of those who self-reported their health as 'poor', compared to those who reported their health as better than 'poor', of belonging to a household that was behind on bills.

rel.ref category (compared to): self-reported  health level which is not 'poor'

disability-related benefit.description: The relative risk of recipients of disability benefits DLA or PIP, compared to non-recipients, of belonging to a household that was behind on bills.

carer.description: The relative risk of those with caring responsibilites, compared to those without, of belonging to a household that was behind on bills.

rel.ref category (compared to): does not having caring responsibilities in household

percent of welfare income from welfare s.description: The change in risk of household bill arrears that was associated by an increase in the percent of household income coming from the welfare state by 33.

rel.category: percent of welfare income from welfare state
rel.variable: Increase in percent of total household income coming from welfare benefits by 33% (rounded)

household income.description: The change in risk of household bill arrears that was associated by an increase in total household income by £4992.

number-of-dependent-children.description: The change in risk of household bill arrears that was associated by an increase in the number of dependent children in household by 1 .

rel.variable: Increase in number of dependent children in household by 1 (rounded)

housing-tenure.description: The relative risk of those with certain housing tenures, compared to those owning their property outright, of belonging to a household that was behind on household bills.

marital-status.description: The relative risk of those with different marital statuses, compared to those who are married,in a civil partnership, or living as a couple, of belonging to a household that was behind on bills.

rel.ref category (compared to): married/civil partner or living as a couple

rel.variable: windowed/surviving civil partner, divorced/dissolved civil partner or separated (incl. from civil partner)
rel.ref category (compared to): married/civil partner or living as a couple

number-inhousehold.description: The change in risk of household bill arrears that was associated by an increase in the number of people in the household by 1.

rel.variable: Increase in number of people in household by 1.6 (rounded)

job-status.description: The relative risk of those with certain job statuses, compared to those in paid employment, of belonging to a household that was behind on bills.

disability.description: The relative risk of those with a long-standing illness or disability, compard to those without, of belonging to a household that was behind on household bills.

universal-credit.description: The relative risk of those in reciept of Universal Credit, compared to those not in receipt, of belonging to a household that was behind on household bills.
